channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: US State Department Kills Global Air Monitoring Program Researchers Say Paid for Itself
item.description: The initiative helped pressure the Chinese government to clean up the air in Beijing and was later expanded to dozens of cities around the world. Now,...

item.title: OpenAI’s GPT-4.5 AI model comes to more ChatGPT users
item.description: OpenAI has begun rolling out its newest AI model, GPT-4.5, to users on its ChatGPT Plus tier. In a series of posts on X, OpenAI said that the rollout ...

item.title: Catalan court says NSO Group executives can be charged in spyware investigation
item.description: The ruling said that a lower court can charge two NSO Group co-founders and a former executive of two affiliate companies for the alleged hacking of a...

item.title: OpenAI reportedly plans to charge up to $20,000 a month for specialized AI ‘agents’
item.description: OpenAI may be planning to charge up to $20,000 per month for specialized AI “agents,” according to The Information. The publication reports that OpenA...

item.title: Not all cancer patients need chemo. Ataraxis AI raised $20M to fix that.
item.description: Ataraxis AI has raised a $20.4 million Series A to make cancer treatment more personalized. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use o...

item.title: The Weird and Wacky Gadgets We Saw at MWC 2025
item.description: Look past the glitzy phone launches, and you'll find some truly bizarre, sometimes ingenious devices and concepts lurking in the halls of Mobile World...

item.title: An Overdiagnosis Epidemic Is Harming Patients’ Mental Health
item.description: Diagnosing patients when there aren’t effective treatments to give them can make their symptoms worse, argues neurologist Suzanne O’Sullivan.

item.title: US Charges 12 Alleged Spies in China’s Freewheeling Hacker-for-Hire Ecosystem
item.description: The Justice Department claims 10 alleged hackers and two Chinese government officials took part in a wave of cyberattacks around the globe that includ...

item.title: The Plight of Migrants Is Deeply Misunderstood. Can a Video Game Help?
item.description: Anima Interactive’s forthcoming game Take Us North aims to capture the lived experiences of those trying to cross the US-Mexico border.

item.title: Apple adds AI-powered app review summaries with iOS 18.4
item.description: As part of the iOS 18.4 software update, currently in public beta, Apple is introducing AI-powered summaries of App Store reviews. The new feature wil...
